intro: Fumaria fleischeri, commonly known as the Fleischer's smokeplant, is a flowering plant belonging to the Papaveraceae family. It is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in clusters. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Native to the Mediterranean region, it thrives in dry, sunny habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
